Text.Value: Once Thaniel's essence is found, what then?
Stay here, for now.
I need you to remain at camp for now.
The shadows rended him in two when they bore him away to the Shadowfell. Half of his essence remained here, amidst the curse.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: No. If you linger, you'll only jeopardise your own mission. This is my burden alone now until either the curse is lifted, or I breathe my last.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: How do you know this?
Tell me how I can help.
All right, leave it to me.
In fact, I saw just the sort before, not long after we first came within reach of the shadow curse. Fool that I am, I did not grasp their significance at the time.

EditorData.NodeContext: Moment of realisation. Kicking himself a bit for not putting 2 + 2 together earlier

Text.Value: The shadow curse was always your burden - not mine.
I knew something was wrong when he didn't wake up, but now I'm even more certain.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: I'll be ready.
I swear I can already feel a change in the air - like the curse itself knows its time is short.

EditorData.NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

Text.Value: Still, I would like to return here some day. See Thaniel and Oliver again - in my meditations, or perhaps in person, if the Oak Father wills it. I hope he does.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bittersweet

Text.Value: Gladly. Let's put an end to this, once and for all.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resolute/comradely

Text.Value: Once the curse is lifted, they can stand as one or as a pair. Whatever they wish.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reassuring (mission success)

Text.Value: Perhaps it can be reasoned with, but I'm not hopeful. Reason is not something that thrives amidst the shadow curse.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some foreboding.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: I can't say for certain, but we'll see it come to pass long before this place recedes behind us. Don't worry - all is at hand. We can depart whenever you're ready.

EditorData.NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

Text.Value: No matter how it's been twisted by the shadows, it is still part of Thaniel's essence - it will resemble him somehow, and may show signs of his power.

EditorData.NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: It's both simple and not - we need to find Thaniel's missing half, and make him whole again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: Look for life in the darkness. Wildflowers, where everything else is dead. The curse cannot subdue the power Thaniel bears. Not entirely.

EditorData.NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: No more than my right hand can absorb my left. Oliver is helping Thaniel to recover; they both lie dormant, like trees awaiting spring.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reassuring (mission success)

Text.Value: Join me.
Let me help you then. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stalwart, heartfelt

Text.Value: Leave.
What happened to Oliver, exactly? Did Thaniel... absorb him?
You prevailed, my friend. Now your path takes you to Baldur's Gate... but I cannot join you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: I found a Flaming Fist who escaped the Shadowfell - but he's dead.
We need to find Oliver and get him to return to Thaniel. Otherwise this curse will never be lifted.

EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: Come with me. I might need you out there.
This place needs me. I wish it were different - I truly do. As long as the curse remains, so must I.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: I'm glad I could help.
This isn't what I wish. It's simply the way it has to be - I'm sorry.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: No, my friend. The only thing I ask of you is to allow me by your side on the road ahead. I still owe you a debt, and I intend to pay.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reassuring (mission success)

Text.Value: I will miss you, my friend. Perhaps our paths will cross again some day, if the sun ever shines on this place once more.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: You flirting with me, big man? Why not spare the talk and get straight to the sweaty part?
Leave.
This doesn't have to be your burden alone. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stalwart, heartfelt

Text.Value: What stayed behind would have been the strongest part of him. But after all these years left in darkness, corruption must have taken hold.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: Yes, and so it must remain. I wish you success on your path. Had things been different, I might have walked it with you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: If you want me, I'm yours. Against the curse, against the Absolute - anything. Just say the word.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stalwart, heartfelt

Text.Value: Good - this is what we've been lacking. Now there's a chance we can find Thaniel, and bring him home.
Share what you learned of Thaniel's presence in the Shadowfell.
Thaniel still suffers. There'll be no improvement until his essence is restored, I fear.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: Perhaps not - if he truly is a part of Thaniel, then he is beyond life and death. More likely he's just hiding. We should return to where you saw him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Intrigued/motivated. A chance to lift the curse might be at hand

Text.Value: Seems your ranks are quite packed. If some space frees up, I'll be ready for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'You're full up, unfortunately'

Text.Value: I'll see what I can do, but no promises.
I knew I could put my faith in you. If only we had met sooner.

EditorData.NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

Text.Value: And I truly mean we. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.

EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent/motivated. A chance to lift the curse might be at hand

Text.Value: I need you to remain at camp for now.
This 'more' that you want. What is it?
I'm glad to have you.
And you saw this boy yourself? That can't be a coincidence - but we need to be sure.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'Could it be...?' Sounds like a promising lead in lifting the curse

Text.Value: What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
Perhaps there's still a way to learn something from him - the dead can't deny their knowledge, if asked the right question.
What comes next will prove dangerous. Meet me by the shore outside Last Light - we can do our work there without imperilling others.
Thaniel rests well. He's healing very rapidly, now that Oliver has returned to him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

Text.Value: Not what. Who. But all in due course.
There is a ruin, some way outside of Last Light. I caught a glimpse of fresh blooms there, but did not investigate further. I shall mark it upon your map.
Join me.
The same. I had hoped I might have been able to stay by your side, to help however I could. But the Oak Father has spoken - my place is here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: Do as you wish.
Any ideas on how to find this missing half?
I met a shadow child named Oliver, resembling Thaniel - but he's dead now.
Only, the missing half may not come willingly. The curse will have sunk its tendrils deep, twisting Thaniel's essence into something... else.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some foreboding. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: I hope they will remain as a pair. It would be good for them both to have a friend, once I'm gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bittersweet. The kids are growing up.

Text.Value: I hope you've no more requests - I need to take care of my own problems.
I'm sorry things didn't turn out differently.
You have to come - I need you.
And I'm glad to be had - glad to be with you, I mean.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slight pause in the middle to correct his phrasing for any perceived innuendo

Text.Value: In truth, I'm not sure. This is beyond all reckoning. It's still part of Thaniel, deep down, but it may not recognise that, or want to recognise that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: Perhaps we can still do something to lift the curse.
Poor soul... but in truth, if I had to choose between death and the Shadowfell, I'd choose death.
I met a sort of shadow child before - a little boy named Oliver. Around Thaniel's age.
Anyway, once the curse is lifted, nature can take its course without me. I belong at your side.

EditorData.NodeContext: His mission was a success, now he's forward-looking to the player's needs.

Text.Value: Good. Now our roots can deepen - together.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resolute/comradely

Text.Value: By now, we should have seen some small glimmer of Thaniel's power - a sign that the land is healing. New growth, flowers in bloom. But there has been nothing.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: Out there the curse still thrives. I failed this place - now I must remain behind, and stand watch over it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

Text.Value: You are not bound by social niceties, I see. I like that. Perhaps I can show you just how much, another time.

EditorData.NodeContext: Flirty. Enjoying the player's direct approach.

Text.Value: Thaniel rests still, but it's no easy slumber.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Text.Value: I have. But perhaps there is more that I want...

EditorData.NodeContext: A little smoldering intensity/longing in the second line. Like he's seeing the player with new, romantic eyes.

Text.Value: Can it be undone?
So when will the curse actually be lifted?
Perhaps - if we can find Thaniel's lost half, and make him whole again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

Synopsis:
Dialogue with Halsin in the epilogue of Act 2. In it, he reacts to the various states that could occur in relation to his desire to rid the Act 2 region of the shadow curse:
- if you've already done everything needed to ensure success. he's grateful and seeks to remain with you on the journey to Baldur's Gate.
- if the curse is not yet sure to be lifted, but there's still something that can be done (ie Thaniel was saved from the Shadowfell, but hasn't been fully restored), he will implore the players to help and offer to join them.
- if it's no longer possible to lift the curse, Halsin is sad and resigned to staying behind to stand sentry over it. He will not be available as a companion in Act 3, and his story effectively ends here.
